misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that every distinct input value must be stored in its own unique, named variable to be individually checked and processed, rather than reusing a single variable within a loop structure.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: The student fails to recognize that the notional machine can process an arbitrary number of inputs by reusing a single memory location (variable) over time through iteration (e.g., using a for-loop to read and sum values one by one).
misconceptions.error_manifestation: The code relies on redundant variable declarations and duplicated conditional logic, which results in hard-coded limitations and prevents the program from scaling to larger or variable-sized input sets.
